body: Just beneath the fold on the https://electron.atom.io website, there is a link to [watch the video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8YP_nOCO-4Q&feature=youtu.be): which explains that Electron is a framework for building native applications with the same tools you use for web applications. It also explains this just above the link to the video: > Electron is a framework for creating native applications with web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. A little beneath that there is a whole section with options on how to get started: Including: - A link to the [API Demos app](https://github.com/electron/electron-api-demos) which has examples of what is possible with Electron and the code to achieve it - A link to the [Quick Start app](https://github.com/electron/electron-quick-start) (which also points you to the [Quick Start tutorial](http://electron.atom.io/docs/tutorial/quick-start/) - A link to the documentation that has numerous tutorials - Suggestions on other resources such as Discuss, Slack, Twitter and email I hope that gives you more resources to choose from. Let us know if you have any other questions.
